p: To obtain the essential oil, the leaves were the part of the plant mostly used in the experiments, sometimes together with fine stems. Regarding extraction methods, hydro-distillation (HD) by the conventional method using a Clevenger type apparatus was the most common, except in the experiments that defined the synergistic effect of the EO, which used steam-distillation (SD) to extract the oil. Gas chromatography was the basic procedure used, mainly together with mass spectrometry, to analyse and determine its chemical properties.
